macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: India's Sensex and Nifty Plunge Over 1,000 Points on Budget 2026 Day
items.summary: Benchmark indices tumbled sharply during Sunday's special trading session ahead of Union Budget 2026, with BSE Sensex down over 1,000 points and NSE Nifty50 falling below 25,000. Markets had opened higher but reversed amid budget uncertainties and global factors.

items.title: FTSE 100 Rises 0.5% to 10,224, FTSE 250 Flat at 23,253 for Week
items.summary: UK equities edged higher last week, closing with FTSE 100 up 0.5% at 10,224 points and FTSE 250 little changed at 23,253. Commodity markets saw sharp reversals on Friday amid mixed global sentiment.

items.title: US Dollar Strengthens Sharply, DXY Gains as Gold and Silver Plunge
items.summary: The US Dollar made a powerful comeback on Friday with DXY index surging, reducing appeal for gold, silver, and crypto; silver plunged over 25% intraday, falling more than $10 in 24 hours. Gold hit records earlier but faced pressure from dollar rebound.

items.title: Bitcoin Drops Below $80,000 Support to $78,678 Amid Bearish Wedge Pattern
items.summary: Bitcoin fell below key $80,000 support on Sunday to $78,678 from all-time high of $126,300, forming a bearish rising wedge pattern with downside path of least resistance.

items.title: S&P 500 Surpasses 7,000 for First Time; Gold Races Toward $5,000 Record
items.summary: S&P 500 pushed above 7,000 mark for the first time last week; gold poised for best weekly gain since 2008, racing toward $5,000 amid Trump tariff comments and dollar weakness earlier.

items.title: Kevin Warsh Nomination Speculation Boosts Rate Cut Hopes Despite Powell Criticism
items.summary: Markets reacted swiftly to probable Kevin Warsh Fed appointment rumors; Warsh criticizes Powell and pushes lower rates, with analysts comfortable amid structural distrust in monetary policy driving gold highs.

items.title: Oil Prices Decline: WTI $59.36 (-$1.26), Brent $64.06 (-$1.19)
items.summary: Oil markets saw sharp drops with WTI March futures at $59.36 down $1.26 and Brent at $64.06 down $1.19, amid commodity reversals.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Drops Below $76,000 Triggering $2.2 Billion Liquidations
items.summary: Bitcoin briefly fell below $76,000 on February 1, 2026, causing nearly $2.2 billion in cryptocurrency futures liquidations across the network, with Ethereum at $961 million and Bitcoin at $679 million. The event marks the highest single-day liquidation since October 11.

items.title: Cryptocurrency Market Shows Mixed Performance with ZK Up 11.53%
items.summary: On February 1, ZK led gains at $0.0248 with an 11.53% increase, followed by ZRO up 3.54%, while RAY dropped 8.41% to $0.758 and AXS fell 5.52% to $1.792. Other movers include XRP up 1.54% to $1.660 and SAND down 4.79% to $0.101.

items.title: SEC Issues Guidance on Tokenized Stocks Facing Same Rules as Traditional Stocks
items.summary: The U.S. SEC on January 29 clarified that tokenized stocks must follow the same regulations as ordinary stocks, dashing hopes for lighter oversight. This contributed to market uncertainty amid $3 billion net outflows from spot ETFs over two weeks.

items.title: AI Predictions Suggest XRP May Hold Above $1 in February Despite Volatility
items.summary: Multiple AIs predict XRP, down 30% from its monthly peak and at around $1.70, will likely defend the $1 level in February amid consolidation and selling pressure, though risks remain from geopolitical tensions and ETF outflows.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Lloyds Banking Group Projects $127M Value from Generative AI in 2026
items.summary: Lloyds Banking Group reports generative AI delivered $63M in value in 2025 and expects it to double to $127M over the next 12 months as part of its digital transformation push.

items.title: Deepfake Job Seeker Targets AI Security Firm in Interview Scam
items.summary: A deepfake video was used by a scammer to apply for a security researcher role at an AI threat modeling company, highlighting rising deepfake risks in hiring; detection tools confirmed the fraud.

items.title: 64% of Nurses Fear Lack of Legal Protection from AI-Caused Patient Harm
items.summary: A survey reveals 64% of nurses would not feel legally protected if an AI tool caused patient harm, amid growing AI adoption in healthcare; 59% of patients use apps for medication management.

items.title: AI Shifts from Answering Prompts to Executing Real-World Actions
items.summary: AI systems are evolving beyond response-based interactions to perform actual tasks autonomously, transforming workflows and productivity in various industries.

items.title: Physics Models and ML Integration Boosts Automated Drilling Performance
items.summary: A new approach combines physics models and machine learning algorithms with precise rig control to achieve high-performance automated sliding in drilling, meeting top driller standards.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Multiple New Dragon Ball Video Game Projects Announced in Livestream
items.summary: A special livestream revealed several new Dragon Ball projects, including updates to Sparking Zero, a revival of the Budokai Tenkaichi series with high production standards and numerous characters.

items.title: New Virtual Boy Games Zero Racers and D-Hopper Announced for 2026 Switch Online
items.summary: Nintendo announced two previously unreleased Virtual Boy games, Zero Racers and D-Hopper, coming to the Nintendo Switch Online Expansion Pack's Virtual Boy Classics line in 2026.

items.title: Rayman 30th Anniversary Edition Leaked
items.summary: Details of a Rayman 30th Anniversary Edition have leaked, sparking discussion about the franchise's future.

items.title: Tomodachi Life: Livin’ Da Dream Direct Announced
items.summary: Nintendo revealed a Direct presentation for Tomodachi Life: Livin’ Da Dream, focusing on living the dream in the life sim series.

items.title: Over 25% of Game Workers Laid Off According to GDC Polling
items.summary: GDC polling indicates more than a quarter of all games industry workers have faced layoffs amid ongoing challenges.

items.title: PlayStation 2026 Roadmap Features Xbox Ports Like Marathon, Fable, and Halo
items.summary: Sony's 2026 lineup includes Xbox ports such as Marathon in March, Fable, Halo: Campaign Evolved, and others, alongside concerns over live-service titles like Fairgames.

items.title: Video Game Companies Face High Costs and Worker Strikes
items.summary: NPR reports on expensive price tags and worker strikes contributing to difficulties for video game companies.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Waabi Raises $750M in Series C for Autonomous Vehicles
items.summary: Autonomous vehicle startup Waabi secured $750 million in a Series C round co-led by Khosla Ventures and G2 Venture Partners, plus $250 million milestone capital from Uber for deploying 25,000+ robotaxis on its platform.

items.title: Gatik AI Signs $600M Driverless Trucking Deal
items.summary: Gatik AI, focused on middle-mile autonomous trucks, inked a five-year contract worth $600 million with a major consumer-goods company for fully driverless transport of goods between distribution centers and stores.

items.title: Uber Launches Uber AV Labs for Data Sharing
items.summary: Uber introduced Uber AV Labs to collect and share data from sensor-equipped cars with partners like Lucid, Waymo, and Waabi, focusing on data collaboration rather than developing its own robotaxis.

items.title: Tesla Faces Rebranding Challenges Amid EV Revenue Focus
items.summary: Tesla's aspirational branding is clashing with financial realities, as the majority of its revenue continues to derive from electric vehicle sales, per latest earnings.

items.title: Obi Reports Narrowing Price Gap in Bay Area Ride-Hailing
items.summary: Data from ride-hailing aggregator Obi shows the price difference between Waymo robotaxis and Uber/Lyft rides in the San Francisco Bay Area is decreasing.
